cwn_entry.cwn_title: Next OUPS meetings: June, 19 and July, 8
cwn_entry.cwn_what:
The next OUPS meetings will take place on the 19th of June, and the 8th of July.
On the 19th of June, we will have an hacking party at Irill, starting at 7pm. More information (in French) here http://www.meetup.com/ocaml-paris/events/186465512/ In particular, we plan to have a compiler hacking party, under the supervision of Gabriel Scherer, and a more "open ended" hacking session.
On the 8th of July, we will have a regular OUPS meeting taking place in the Mozilla Space in Paris. More information to come here http://www.meetup.com/ocaml-paris/events/188634632/
For both events, registration via meetup is preferable. If you do not wish to do so, please send me an email if you want to be counted for food.

Today saw the release of Unicode 7.0.0.
This means 2834 new characters [1] — if you are looking for pointless new arrows to write unreadable computer science papers, you’ll get them.
New characters means updates to both Uucd and Uunf:
# Uucd
Uucd is a module that decodes the data of the Unicode character database from its XML representation.
This is a major, incompatible, release as new enumerants were introduced in the character properties.
Release notes: https://github.com/dbuenzli/uucd/blob/v2.0.0/CHANGES.md Project home page: http://erratique.ch/software/uucd API doc & examples: http://erratique.ch/software/uucd/doc/Uucd
# Uunf
Uunf is a module for normalizing Unicode text.
This is a minor release, only the internal data changes.
Release notes: https://github.com/dbuenzli/uunf/blob/v0.9.3/CHANGES.md Project home page: http://erratique.ch/software/uunf API doc & examples: http://erratique.ch/software/uunf/doc/Uunf
The new versions should be available shortly in opam.
Best,
Daniel
[1] Listed here http://www.unicode.org/charts/PDF/Unicode-7.0/

Thanks to Alp Mestan, we now include in the OCaml Weekly News the links to the recent posts from the ocamlcore planet blog at <http://planet.ocaml.org/>.
Uucd 2.0.0 and Uunf 0.9.3: <http://erratique.ch/software>
